ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Yahoo Groups is being deleted
ygData.msgSnippet: My understanding is that the email list functionality will remain, for the time being anyways, but any uploaded/attached files will be deleted, all or most of

X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod
From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...>

My understanding is that the email list functionality will remain, for
the time being anyways, but any uploaded/attached files will be
deleted, all or most of the other functionality available via the web
site will be gone, and the group will become a private group.

Seems to me to be a clear signal to move elsewhere - any suggestions?

Google groups seems like the obvious choice, but I mostly agree with
Sean's comments - it will likely get culled at some point too.

Colin


On Sat, 19 Oct 2019 at 09:23, sean_c4s@... [neat]
<neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
>
>
> https://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2019/10/yahoo-is-deleting-all-content-ever-posted-to-yahoo-groups/
>
> Upper management at google have completely forgotten about google groups or that would be long gone too, like google+.
> As such sites go algorithms are completely putting the kibosh on any freedom of expression where you are not generating content for profit for some company for free.
> Likewise algorithms are increasing taking their cut of any employment you might get.
> You can see where it is all headed can't you?
>
>
